summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Detention Center, transmitting discovery materials to inmate Ghislaine Maxwell in her criminal case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) and the inmate to whom discovery materials are being sent.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed the letter transmitting discovery to Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Strauss, as the U.S. Attorney, is the lead prosecutor in the criminal case against Maxwell.

events.title: Discovery Transmission to Maxwell
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Metropolitan Detention Center, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The document is official correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
It confirms Ghislaine Maxwell was an inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn as of August 2021.
The U.S. Attorney's Office, led by Audrey Strauss, was actively transmitting discovery materials to Maxwell for her defense.
The document references the ongoing federal prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell in the Southern District of New York.
